NOTES: A soldier shot dead a volunteer worker on a bus at the Mbon Ecua checkpoint. The event occured when the bus driver drove on before given the final word to continue from the soldier. The soldier was angry and shot at the bus.
CONSOLIDATED_NOTES: Civilians (Equatorial Guinea) Military Forces of Equatorial Guinea (1979-) A soldier shot dead a volunteer worker on a bus at the Mbon Ecua checkpoint. The event occured when the bus driver drove on before given the final word to continue from the soldier. The soldier was angry and shot at the bus. El Pais

NOTES: Police raided and looted the homes of Cameroonians and intimidated Cameroonians in Bata in their search for two bank robbers.
CONSOLIDATED_NOTES: Police Forces of Equatorial Guinea (1979-) Civilians (Equatorial Guinea) Police raided and looted the homes of Cameroonians and intimidated Cameroonians in Bata in their search for two bank robbers. Reuters

NOTES: Two banks were robbed by armed Cameroonians. The robbers stole cash and shot at civilains passing by. Police responded by raiding and looting the homes of Cameroonians in the city in their search for the robbers.
CONSOLIDATED_NOTES: Unidentified Armed Group (Cameroon) Civilians (Equatorial Guinea) Two banks were robbed by armed Cameroonians. The robbers stole cash and shot at civilains passing by. NOTES: Seven foreigners were found killed in a rubbish yard. The deaths may have been motivated by politics - an exiled political party is investigating the matter and appealing to human rights organizations.

NOTES: Following conviction, The New York-based Human Rights Watch has described the conviction and imprisonment of a prominent member of Equatorial Guinea�s beleaguered political opposition as a travesty of justice. Mansogo, a leading member of the political opposition and prominent human rights defender, has been sentenced on May 7th to three years in prison after a politically motivated trial.
